title: One dead, another critical after hang gliding accident at Lennox Head, NSW
text:
One man is dead and another is in a critical condition after their hang glider crashed in northern NSW this afternoon.

Emergency services were called to the Pat Morton Lookout at Lennox Head just after 12pm to reports the pair had crashed.

A 67-year-old man, believed to be the hang gliding instructor, died at the scene.

His tandem partner, a 26-year-old man, was treated by paramedics before being winched from the cliff by a rescue helicopter and flown to the Gold Coast University Hospital in a critical condition.

Emergency services described the rescue of the young man as “very complex”.

The Sports Aviation Federation of Australia are assisting police with inquiries and police officers have established a crime scene.
